metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18778 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high.
metadata.Description:
ACME mini_httpd before 1.30 lets remote users read arbitrary files. It was discovered that ACME mini_httpd did not properly handle HTTP GET requests with empty headers. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to read arbitrary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18778` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mini-httpd - 1.30-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mini-httpd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.30-2').
